channel.title: Editing A Client [not very indepth, just basic stuff]
channel.description:
[size=17pt]HOW TO EDIT A CLIENT BY LANTHUS20[/size]
[b]DIFFICULTY:[/b] 2/10 maybe? its a bit time consuming but easy!
[b]REQUIREMENTS:[/b] A source, some java knowledge, a client (ill post my source)
[b]TUTORIAL:[/b]
Ill revise this tutorial later, to make it more understandable.
[b]STEP 1:[/b] Getting a Client
You can head over to the downloads section OR just follow this link for my client [url=http://uppit.com/60OSV1]LANTHUS SCAPE CLIENT.zip[/url]
sorry about zip but my friend needed it in a zip file so ill just recycle the link.
[b]STEP 2:[/b] Creating A Background!
First, you need a background, use google to get one or just find one on your computer. Some clients need the background to be flipped. This means taking the halfway line and flipping it around. But if you downloaded mine you dont need to do it. So I wont go indepth into it.
Basically, go into paint, open the file, then use the "select" tool to select the RIGHT half. Right click on it and select flip/rotate, then flip vertical and ok. Save it.
[b]STEP 3:[/b] BASIC EDITING
ok, open up client.java in the clients files. find the ip, so if you've used my client find lanthusscape.no-ip.info. change it to your servers ip. Change the port if you need to, mines set to 43594. Now simply go to edit, replace, type in the source name and then your server name. Click replace all and BAM done. It now says your servers name. Now go into GUI.java or on some its EGUI.java. Just change the links/names. Its simple, the GUI.java file souldnt be too terribly big so it'll be easy to edit. Save and exit. Now go into sprites. Change the sprites to the ones you want. You can download my sprites file here: [url=http://uppit.com/C3EGI2]Sprites.rar[/url]
NOTE: THESE SPRITES ARE FROM MY CLIENT, IF YOU DOWNLOADED MY CLIENT SKIP THIS STEP, IF YOU DONT WANT THEM SKIP ALSO.
PREVIEW
[url=http://www.servimg.com/image_preview.php?i=76&u=12153951][img]http://i45.servimg.com/u/f45/12/15/39/51/tut110.jpg[/img][/url]
Now, it connects to your server, has your selected sprites, your servers name etc. Links to your site if there were any. You get what im babblin on about.
[b]STEP 4:[/b] CHANGING/RECOLORING MODELS
Ok, recoloring is fairly simple. I found a "kit" and i've been using it ever since. [url=http://uppit.com/BL3W1R]MODEL RECOLORING.rar[/url]
theres guides in there. an item dump, rsmv, runescaoe model grabber, gzip. Everything you'll need.
I TAKE NO CREDIT WHATSOEVER
so, since whats in there'll help you out I dont need to touch on this anymore.
My client comes packed with models (ok, not packed but enough).
oh, yah I sould probably tell you recoloring is done in class 8.java
Thats, well... the basic stuff to creating clients. So tutorial over? I'll add things if I come across them.
That was my second tutorial, its not indepth or anything but It SOULD work. If you have any problems post them here. DO NOT PM ME I WILL IGNORE IT!

item.title: Editing A Client [not very indepth, just basic stuff]
item.dc:creator: @Lanthus20 Lanthus20
item.description:
@Lanthus20 wrote:

…basically a client is the thing that plays your server.

So until now you’ve probably been using the moparscape client. This tutorial just tells you how to make a personalized client all your players can use.

all you’d do is edit the ip (explained above)

this tutorial is basically only to get you a client. There are other more indepth tutorials but this one deals ONLY with getting a client, making it connect to your server, changing sprites and names. + i added the model changing/recoloring thing

Read full topic
